Affective Support Data

Data from the Affective Support Study

The complete data are available in the following formats:

  • Comma Separated Value
  • SPSS Save file

Metadata are available using the readr cols format in this R metadata all script.

The following steps will load the file using the metadata in R.

library(readr)
source("https://pluto.coe.fsu.edu/PhysicsDataPlayground/Data/AllMetadata.R")
PPIESFall2022Full <- 
  read_csv("https://pluto.coe.fsu.edu/PhysicsDataPlayground/Data/PPIESFall2022Full.csv",
           col_types=colAll)

Pretest, Posttest, demographic and Questionnaire data

This data subset contains just the data from the pretest and posttest questionnaires.

Posttest columns are marked with either .ect or .pot depending on which posttest the items appear on. Note that students received the ECT and POT tests on Wednesday or Friday of the study week depending on their treatment group.

Pre, Post Data

The readr::cols metadata is in Pre-post R metadata script.

library(readr)
source("https://pluto.coe.fsu.edu/PhysicsDataPlayground/Data/PrePostMetadata.R")
PPIESFall2022PrePost <- 
  read_csv("https://pluto.coe.fsu.edu/PhysicsDataPlayground/Data/PPIESFall2022PrePost.csv",
           col_types=colPrePost)

An alternative version of the PrePost data which replaces the text of the options for the raw responses, with the codes A, B, C, and D. Pre, Post Data ABC coding

Here is the Recoding Script.

The readr::cols metadata is in Pre-post ABC coding R metadata script.

library(readr)
source("https://pluto.coe.fsu.edu/PhysicsDataPlayground/Data/PrePostMetadataABC.R")
PPIESFall2022PrePostABC <- 
  read_csv("https://pluto.coe.fsu.edu/PhysicsDataPlayground/Data/PPIESFall2022PrePostABC.csv",
           col_types=colPrePost)

Game level outcome data

These data contain information on how the learning supports were played. * Timestamp_XXX – These give the time at which the level was played. * TrophyLevel_XXX – what trophy the player earned. This can be gold, silver, quit or missing. The quit indicates that the player attempted the level but did not earn a trophy. * NumberAttempts_XXX – The number of attempts the player made for this game level.

Note that the player may have attempted each level several times. There are three versions of this data file, one showing the values related to the first level (.first), one to the last levels (.last) and one showing the best trophy recieved (.max). In the full data set the suffixes .first, .last, and .max are added to the column names to indicate which version is used.

  • Observables, First Attempt
  • Observables, Last Attempt
  • Trophies Only, Last Attempt

The readr::cols metadata is in Observables R metadata script.

library(readr)
source("https://pluto.coe.fsu.edu/PhysicsDataPlayground/Data/ObsMetadata.R")
PPIESFall2022obsFirst <-
  read_csv("https://pluto.coe.fsu.edu/PhysicsDataPlayground/Data/FSUSFall2022obsFirst.csv",
            col_types=colObsFirst)
PPIESFall2022obsLast <-
  read_csv("https://pluto.coe.fsu.edu/PhysicsDataPlayground/Data/FSUSFall2022obsFirst.csv",
            col_types=colObsLast)
PPIESFall2022obsMax <-
  read_csv("https://pluto.coe.fsu.edu/PhysicsDataPlayground/Data/FSUSFall2022obsFirst.csv",
            col_types=colObsMax)

Learning support usage data

This is data about the usage of the learning supports.

Learning Support

The readr::cols metadata is in Learning Support R metadata script.

library(readr)
source("https://pluto.coe.fsu.edu/PhysicsDataPlayground/Data/LSMetadata.R")
PPIESFall2022ls <- 
  read_csv("https://pluto.coe.fsu.edu/PhysicsDataPlayground/Data/PPIESFall2022ls.csv",
           col_types=colLS)

Bayesian network scores

This provides scores from the Bayesian Network model, which probabilities for the nine nodes in the competency model. For each none, there are three columns giving the marginal probability of the High, Medium and Low proficiency respectively. The EAP (expected a posteriori) scores are produced by assigning Low=-1, Medium=0 and High=1 and calculating the expected value.

Bayesian Network Scores

The readr::cols metadata is in Pre-post R metadata script.

library(readr)
source("https://pluto.coe.fsu.edu/PhysicsDataPlayground/Data/PrePostMetadata.R")
PPIESFall2022BN <- 
  read_csv("https://pluto.coe.fsu.edu/PhysicsDataPlayground/Data/PPIESFall2022BN.csv",
           col_types=colBN)

Log files

The raw JSON data is available at https://pluto.coe.fsu.edu/PhysicsPlayground/data/IES2022-AllP4Events.json.gz

The filtered data containing only “interesting” events is at: https://pluto.coe.fsu.edu/PhysicsPlayground/data/PPIES2022-P4Filtered.json.gz

Both files are compressed using gnu zip (gzip)
